RequiredFields.comment: The fields listed here as required fields will be highlighted in the application until they have a value entered

AutoFields.comment: The fields listed here will be overwritten when the data becomes available and updated if it changes (this is primarily for resource files)

GenreSubgenres.comment: The field pairs listed here will be linked as genre subgenre where the subgenre field gets its controlled vocabulary from the genre fields current selection

FieldConstraints.comment: The fields listed here will be required to match the regex constraint and will be highlighted in the application if they do not

FieldTriggers.comment: The field triggers cause the target field to be set after the source field is edited, the value set in the target is determined by the controlled vocabulary on the source field
The primary use fof these triggers are to set the corresponding language code when the language name field is changed is set

The SourceFieldValue sets the source of the data to be inserted into the target field from the source fields controlled vocabulary. Possible values relate to the vocabulary xml format and include: "Content" "Value" "Code" "FollowUp".
The LexiconResource field has no related id field and so is excluded from this list ".METATRANSCRIPT.Session.Resources.LexiconResource(x).MetaLanguages.Language"

ChildNodePaths.comment: The child node paths are used to determin the points at which to add a meta node in the user interface and to provide the text for the meta node name

RootTemplateComponents.comment: The template components that can be added as a discrete file and can be added at the root or corpus branch level via the add menu and the display name for each

AvailableTemplateComponents.comment: The template components that can be added via the add menu and the display name for each

FieldUsage.FieldDescription: The name of this session (also used to name the session in various applications)
The general desciption of this session
The name of this corpus (also used to name this corpus in various applications)
The general description of this corpus
The name of a geographic region
List of the major tasks carried out in the session
List of modalities used in the session

Classifies the subject of the session. Uses preferably an existing library classification scheme such as LCSH. The element has a scheme attribute that indicates what scheme is used. Comments: The element can be repeated but the user should guarantee consistency

The full title of the project
A unique identifier for the project
A value between 1 - 5 where 1 is the lowest quality and 5 is the highest quality

PreferredTreeNodeNameFields.comment: The fields that will be used to name the node in the tree if the field contains a value. The first found value will be used, so the order of this list determines their preference of use in the tree.
